name: National Taiwan University of Science and Technology
display_name: National Taiwan University of Science and Technology
description: The National Taiwan University of Science and Technology was established on August 1, 1974, and served as the first higher education institution of its kind within our nation's technical and vocational education system. The purpose of NTUST is to develop highly trained engineers and managers for the rapidly changes in industry needs; also, to shoulder the duty of the perfection of the technical and vocational education system and the leadership of the innovation breaking.  At present, NTUST is comprised of six colleges (engineering, electrical and computer engineering, management, design, liberal arts and social sciences, and Honors College), covering 23 separate departments and graduate schools, joined with Teacher Education Center.  Current enrollment includes 5,447 undergraduates and 4,508 graduate students with 378 full-time faculties.
